title: (x) subheads in Principles of Freedom minisite - American Scribe {Paul}
content:
’Ullo all. I’ve been searching for sometime for the font used in the Principles of Freedom minisite ( [http://research.history.org/pf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811071457/http:/research.history.org/pf/ "http://research.history.org/pf/")) used in the sub headers for “Documents of Freedom” and “The Epstien Collection” just a bit down the page.

Any of you have any ideas on this? Thanks!

 [‹ (x) Self Service magazine - Via Face Don Black, Caslon Italic Swash {Yves, Flex Master (self)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811071457/http:/typophile.com/node/8088 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Emerge 001 on book spine - FF DIN {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811071457/http:/typophile.com/node/19174 "Go to next forum topic")
author: crimson0emperor

comments.content:
Not sure, but it could be [American Scribe](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811071457/http:/www.texashero.com/americanscribe.html)  
or  
 [National Archive](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811071457/http:/haroldsfonts.com/frontpage.html)

actually, i think it is American Scribe
Crud. I didn’t read the entire question.
Ah yes! It’s American Scribe! Many thanks!
